   20: %%% Purpose : Compiles various modules with tough code
   21: 
   22: -module(receive_post_opt_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   25: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   26: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   27: 	 export/1,recv/1,coverage/1,otp_7980/1,ref_opt/1,
   28: 	 wait/1,recv_in_try/1,double_recv/1,receive_var_zero/1,
   29:          match_built_terms/1,elusive_common_exit/1,
   30:          return_before_receive/1,trapping/1,
   31:          after_expression/1,in_after/1,
   32:          type_optimized_markers/1,
   33:          bs_get_tail/1]).
   34: 
   35: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   36: 
   37: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   38:     Config.
   39: 
   40: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   41:     ok.
   42: 
   43: suite() ->
   44:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   45:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   46: 
   47: all() -> 
   48:     slow_group() ++ [{group,p}].
   49: 
   50: groups() -> 
   51:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   52:       [recv,coverage,otp_7980,export,wait,
   53:        recv_in_try,double_recv,receive_var_zero,
   54:        match_built_terms,elusive_common_exit,
   55:        return_before_receive,trapping,
   56:        after_expression,in_after,
   57:        type_optimized_markers,
   58:        bs_get_tail]},
   59:      {slow,[],[ref_opt]}].
   60: 
   61: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   62:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   66:     ok.
   67: 
   68: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: slow_group() ->
   75:     case ?MODULE of
   76: 	receive_SUITE ->
   77:             %% Canononical module name. Run slow cases.
   78:             [{group,slow}];
   79:         _ ->
   80:             %% Cloned module. Don't run.
   81:             []
   82:     end.
   83: 
   84: -record(state, {ena = true}).
   85: 
   86: recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   87:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> loop(#state{}) end),
   88:     Self = self(),
   89:     Pid ! {Self,test},
   90:     receive
   91: 	{ok,test} -> ok;
   92: 	{error,Other} ->
   93: 	    io:format("Got unpexected ~p", [Other]),
   94: 	    ct:fail(unexpected)
   95:     after 10000 ->
   96: 	    ct:fail(no_answer)
   97:     end,
   98:     receive
   99: 	X ->
  100: 	    io:format("Unexpected extra message: ~p", [X]),
  101: 	    ct:fail(unexpected)
  102:     after 10 ->
  103:             unlink(Pid),
  104:             exit(Pid, kill),
  105: 	    ok
  106:     end,
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: loop(S) ->
  110:     receive
  111: 	_ when S#state.ena == false ->
  112: 	    loop(S);
  113: 	{P,test} ->
  114: 	    P ! {ok,test},
  115: 	    loop(S);
  116: 	_X ->
  117: 	    loop(S)
  118:     end.
  119: 
  120: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     do_link(self()),
  122:     do_unlink(self()),
  123:     do_monitor_node(node(), true),
  124:     do_monitor_node(node(), false),
  125:     do_group_leader(group_leader(), self()),
  126:     id(node(self())),
  127: 
  128:     erlang:'!'(self(), {a,10}),
  129:     self() ! {b,20},
  130:     [{a,10},{b,20}] = receive_all(),
  131:     self() ! {c,42},
  132:     receive
  133: 	{c,42} ->
  134: 	    ok
  135:     after infinity ->
  136: 	    exit(cant_happen)
  137:     end,
  138: 
  139:     self() ! 17,
  140:     self() ! 19,
  141:     59 = tuple_to_values(infinity, x),
  142:     61 = tuple_to_values(999999, x),
  143:     0 = tuple_to_values(1, x),
  144: 
  145:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,[]},_}} = (catch monitor_plus_badmap(self())),
  146: 
  147: 
  148:     self() ! {data,no_data},
  149:     ok = receive_sink_tuple({any,pattern}),
  150:     {b,a} = receive_sink_tuple({a,b}),
  151: 
  152:     %% Basically a smoke test of no_clauses_left/0.
  153:     smoke_receive(fun no_clauses_left_1/0),
  154:     smoke_receive(fun no_clauses_left_2/0),
  155:     smoke_receive(fun no_clauses_left_3/0),
  156: 
  157:     receive_in_called_function(),
  158: 
  159:     %% Make we haven't broken `timeout_locked` by inserting recv_marker_clear
  160:     %% in the wrong place.
  161:     Ref = make_ref(),
  162:     receive Ref -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
  163: 
  164:     %% Cover handling of critical edges in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  165:     self() ! ok, ok = mc_fail_requests(),
  166:     self() ! {error, true}, ok = mc_fail_requests(),
  167:     self() ! {error, false}, self() ! {'DOWN', false}, ok = mc_fail_requests(),
  168: 
  169:     Tid = {commit,[]},
  170:     self() ! {Tid, pre_commit},
  171:     self() ! {Tid, committed},
  172:     ok = commit_participant(whatever, Tid),
  173: 
  174:     %% Cover handling in beam_kernel_to_ssa of a `receive` at the end of
  175:     %% an `after` block.
  176:     X = id(fun() -> ok end),
  177:     self() ! whatever,
  178:     try
  179:         X()
  180:     after
  181:         %% Smallish `after` blocks are not moved out to a wrapper
  182:         %% function, so we will need some filler code to force it
  183:         %% to move out.
  184:         length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]),
  185:         length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]),
  186:         length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]),
  187:         length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]), length([X]),
  188:         receive _ -> ignored end
  189:     end,
  190: 
  191:     %% Cover code for handling a non-boolean `br` in beam_ssa_dead.
  192:     self() ! whatever,
  193:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} = (catch [a || other = receive whatever -> false end]),
  194: 
  195:     %% Cover code in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  196:     self() ! 0,
  197:     42 = receive_in_try_and_after(),
  198: 
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: receive_in_called_function() ->
  202:     RefA = make_ref(),
  203:     RefB = returns_reference(),
  204: 
  205:     self() ! hello,
  206:     self() ! RefA,
  207: 
  208:     ricf_1(hello, RefA),
  209: 
  210:     self() ! RefB,
  211:     self() ! hello,
  212: 
  213:     ricf_1(RefB, hello),
  214: 
  215:     Foo = id(gurka),
  216:     Bar = id(gaffel),
  217: 
  218:     self() ! Foo,
  219:     self() ! Bar,
  220: 
  221:     ricf_1(Foo, Bar),
  222: 
  223:     ok.
  224: 
  225: returns_reference() ->
  226:     make_ref().
  227: 
  228: ricf_1(A, B) ->
  229:     %% Both A and B are fed a reference at least once, so both of these loops
  230:     %% ought to be optimized.
  231:     receive A -> ok end,
  232:     receive B -> ok end.
  233: 
  234: monitor_plus_badmap(Pid) ->
  235:     monitor(process, Pid) + []#{}.
  236: 
  237: receive_all() ->
  238:     receive
  239: 	Any ->
  240: 	    [Any|receive_all()]
  241:     after 0 ->
  242: 	    []
  243:     end.
  244: 
  245: do_monitor_node(Node, Bool) ->
  246:     monitor_node(Node, Bool).
  247: 
  248: do_link(Pid) ->
  249:     link(Pid).
  250: 
  251: do_unlink(Pid) ->
  252:     unlink(Pid).
  253: 
  254: do_group_leader(Leader, Pid) ->
  255:     group_leader(Leader, Pid).
  256: 
  257: 
  258: %% cover sys_core_fold:tuple_to_values/2
  259: tuple_to_values(infinity, X) ->
  260:     {A,B} = case X of
  261: 		x ->
  262: 		    receive
  263: 			Any ->
  264: 			    {42,Any}
  265: 		    end
  266: 	    end,
  267:     A+B;
  268: tuple_to_values(Timeout, X) ->
  269:     {A,B} = case X of
  270: 		x ->
  271: 		    receive
  272: 			Any ->
  273: 			    {42,Any}
  274: 		    after Timeout ->
  275: 			    {0,0}
  276: 		    end
  277: 	    end,
  278:     A+B.
  279: 
  280: no_clauses_left_1() ->
  281:     receive
  282:         %% This clause would be removed because it cannot match...
  283:         a = b ->
  284:             V = whatever
  285:     end,
  286:     %% ... leaving a reference to an unbound variable. Crash.
  287:     V.
  288: 
  289: no_clauses_left_2() ->
  290:     [receive
  291:          %% This clause would be removed because it cannot match...
  292:          a = <<V0:(node())>> ->
  293:              year
  294:      end],
  295:     %% ... leaving a reference to an unbound variable. Crash.
  296:     V0.
  297: 
  298: no_clauses_left_3() ->
  299:     case id([]) of
  300:         [] ->
  301:             receive
  302:                 [Var] = [] ->
  303:                     ok
  304:             end
  305:     end,
  306:     Var.
  307: 
  308: %% Cover a help function for beam_ssa_opt:ssa_opt_sink/1.
  309: receive_sink_tuple({Line,Pattern}) ->
  310:     receive
  311:         {data,_} ->
  312:             ok
  313:     after 1 ->
  314:             id({Pattern,Line})
  315:     end.
  316: 
  317: %% Cover handling of critical edges in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  318: mc_fail_requests() ->
  319:     receive
  320:         ok ->
  321:             ok;
  322:         {error, ReqId} ->
  323:             case id(ReqId) of
  324:                 true ->
  325:                     ok;
  326:                 false ->
  327:                     receive
  328:                         {'DOWN', ReqId} ->
  329:                             ok
  330:                     after 0 ->
  331:                             ct:fail(failed)
  332:                     end
  333:             end
  334:     after 0 ->
  335:             ct:fail(failed)
  336:     end,
  337:     ok.
  338: 
  339: %% Cover handling of critical edges in beam_ssa_pre_codegen.
  340: -record(commit, {schema_ops}).
  341: commit_participant(Coord, Tid) ->
  342:     try id(Tid) of
  343:         C ->
  344:             receive
  345:                 {Tid, pre_commit} ->
  346:                     ExpectAck = C#commit.schema_ops /= [],
  347:                     receive
  348:                         {Tid, committed} ->
  349:                             case ExpectAck of
  350:                                 false ->
  351:                                     ignore;
  352:                                 true ->
  353:                                     id(Coord)
  354:                             end;
  355:                         Other ->
  356:                             Other
  357:                     end
  358:             after 0 ->
  359:                     ct:fail(failed)
  360:             end
  361:     catch
  362:         _:_ ->
  363:             ok
  364:     end,
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: receive_in_try_and_after() ->
  368:     try
  369:         id(42)
  370:     catch
  371:         _:V0 when true#{}; whatever ->
  372:             receive
  373:                 _ when 1; V0 ->
  374:                     1
  375:             end
  376:     after
  377:         receive
  378:             0 ->
  379:                 car
  380:         end
  381:     end.
  382: 
  383: %% OTP-7980. Thanks to Vincent de Phily. The following code would
  384: %% be inccorrectly optimized by beam_jump.
  385: 
  386: otp_7980(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     7 = otp_7980_add_clients(10),
  388:     ok.
  389: 
  390: otp_7980_add_clients(Count) ->
  391:     Timeout = 42,
  392:     lists:foldl(fun(_, N) ->
  393: 			case N of
  394:                            1 -> ok;
  395: 			    _ -> receive after Timeout -> ok end
  396: 			end,
  397: 			N - 1
  398: 		end, Count, [1,2,3]).
  399: 
  400: ref_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  401:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  402:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  403:     Sources = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([DataDir,"ref_opt","*.{erl,S}"])),
  404:     test_lib:p_run(fun(Src) ->
  405: 			   do_ref_opt(Src, PrivDir)
  406: 		   end, Sources),
  407:     cover_recv_instructions(),
  408:     ok.
  409: 
  410: do_ref_opt(Source, PrivDir) ->
  411:     try
  412: 	Ext = filename:extension(Source),
  413: 	{ok,Mod} = compile:file(Source, [report_errors,report_warnings,
  414: 					 {outdir,PrivDir}] ++
  415: 					[from_asm || Ext =:= ".S" ]),
  416: 	Base = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source), Ext),
  417: 	code:purge(list_to_atom(Base)),
  418: 	BeamFile = filename:join(PrivDir, Base),
  419: 	code:load_abs(BeamFile),
  420: 	ok = Mod:Mod(),
  421: 	{beam_file,Mod,_,_,_,Code} = beam_disasm:file(BeamFile),
  422: 	case Base of
  423: 	    "no_"++_ ->
  424: 		[] = collect_recv_opt_instrs(Code);
  425: 	    "yes_"++_ ->
  426:                 Instrs = collect_recv_opt_instrs(Code),
  427: 
  428:                 %% At least one of each marker instruction must be present in
  429:                 %% the module.
  430:                 true = lists:any(fun
  431:                                      ({recv_marker_reserve,_}) -> true;
  432:                                      (_) -> false
  433:                                 end, Instrs),
  434:                 true = lists:any(fun
  435:                                      ({recv_marker_bind,_,_}) -> true;
  436:                                      (_) -> false
  437:                                 end, Instrs),
  438:                 true = lists:any(fun
  439:                                      ({recv_marker_clear,_}) -> true;
  440:                                      (_) -> false
  441:                                 end, Instrs),
  442:                 true = lists:any(fun
  443:                                      ({recv_marker_use,_}) -> true;
  444:                                      (_) -> false
  445:                                 end, Instrs)
  446: 	end,
  447: 	ok
  448:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
  449: 	    io:format("~s: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Source,Class,Error,Stk]),
  450: 	    error
  451:     end.
  452: 
  453: collect_recv_opt_instrs(Code) ->
  454:     L = [ [I || I <- Is,
  455: 		begin
  456: 		    case I of
  457: 			{recv_marker_bind,_,_} -> true;
  458: 			{recv_marker_clear,_} -> true;
  459: 			{recv_marker_reserve,_} -> true;
  460: 			{recv_marker_use,_} -> true;
  461: 			_ -> false
  462: 		    end
  463: 		end] || {function,_,_,_,Is} <- Code],
  464:     lists:append(L).
  465: 
  466: cover_recv_instructions() ->
  467:     %% We want to cover the handling of receive markers in beam_utils.
  468:     %% Since those instructions are introduced in a late optimization pass,
  469:     %% beam_utils:live_opt() will not see them unless the compilation is
  470:     %% started from a .S file. The compile_SUITE:asm/1 test case will
  471:     %% compile all test suite files to .S and then run them through the
  472:     %% compiler again.
  473:     %%
  474:     %% Here will we will ensure that this modules contains recv_mark
  475:     %% and recv_set instructions.
  476:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
  477: 			     receive {Parent,Ref} ->
  478: 				     Parent ! Ref
  479: 			     end
  480: 		     end),
  481:     Ref = make_ref(),
  482:     Pid ! {self(),Ref},
  483:     receive
  484: 	Ref -> ok
  485:     end.
  486: 
  487: export(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  488:     Ref = make_ref(),
  489:     self() ! {result,Ref,42},
  490:     42 = export_1(Ref),
  491:     {error,timeout} = export_1(Ref),
  492: 
  493:     self() ! {result,Ref},
  494:     {ok,Ref} = export_2(),
  495: 
  496:     ok.
  497: 
  498: export_1(Reference) ->
  499:     id(Reference),
  500:     receive
  501: 	{result,Reference,Result} ->
  502: 	    Result
  503:     after 1 ->
  504: 	    Result = {error,timeout}
  505:     end,
  506:     %% Result ({x,1}) is used, but not the return value ({x,0})
  507:     %% of the receive. Used to be incorrectly optimized
  508:     %% by beam_block.
  509:     id({build,self()}),
  510:     Result.
  511: 
  512: export_2() ->
  513:     receive {result,Result} -> ok end,
  514:     {ok,Result}.
  515: 
  516: wait(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  517:     self() ! <<42>>,
  518:     <<42>> = wait_1(r, 1, 2),
  519:     {1,2,3} = wait_1(1, 2, 3),
  520:     {'EXIT',{timeout_value,_}} = (catch receive after [] -> timeout end),
  521:     ok.
  522: 
  523: wait_1(r, _, _) ->
  524:     receive
  525: 	B when byte_size(B) > 0 ->
  526: 	    B
  527:     end;
  528: %% beam_utils would wrongly assume that wait/1 could fall through
  529: %% to the next clause.
  530: wait_1(A, B, C) ->
  531:     {A,B,C}.
  532: 
  533: recv_in_try(_Config) ->
  534:     self() ! {ok,fh}, {ok,fh} = recv_in_try_1(infinity, native),
  535:     self() ! {ok,ignored}, {ok,42} = recv_in_try_1(infinity, plain),
  536:     self() ! {error,ignored}, nok = recv_in_try_1(infinity, plain),
  537:     timeout = recv_in_try_1(1, plain),
  538: 
  539:     smoke_receive(fun recv_in_try_2/0),
  540:     smoke_receive(fun recv_in_try_3/0),
  541:     smoke_receive(fun recv_in_try_4/0),
  542:     smoke_receive(fun recv_in_try_5/0),
  543:     smoke_receive(fun recv_in_catch_1/0),
  544: 
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: recv_in_try_1(Timeout, Format) ->
  548:     try
  549: 	receive
  550: 	    {Status,History} ->
  551:                 %% {test,is_tuple,{f,148},[{x,0}]}.
  552:                 %% {test,test_arity,{f,148},[{x,0},2]}.
  553:                 %% {get_tuple_element,{x,0},0,{y,1}}.  %y1 is fragile.
  554:                 %%
  555:                 %% %% Here the fragility of y1 would be be propagated to
  556:                 %% %% the 'catch' below. Incorrect, since get_tuple_element
  557:                 %% %% can't fail.
  558:                 %% {get_tuple_element,{x,0},1,{x,2}}.
  559:                 %%
  560:                 %% remove_message.                     %y1 fragility cleared.
  561: 		FH = case Format of
  562: 			native ->
  563:                              id(History);
  564: 			plain ->
  565:                              id(42)
  566: 		    end,
  567: 		case Status of
  568: 		    ok ->
  569: 			{ok,FH};
  570: 		    error ->
  571: 			nok
  572: 		end
  573: 	after Timeout ->
  574: 		timeout
  575: 	end
  576:     catch
  577:         %% The fragility of y1 incorrectly propagated to here.
  578:         %% beam_validator would complain.
  579: 	throw:{error,Reason} ->
  580: 	    {nok,Reason}
  581:     end.
  582: 
  583: recv_in_try_2() ->
  584:     try
  585:         %% The live range of the try tag would stop here because of
  586:         %% the infinite receive below. The code generator would
  587:         %% generate a kill instruction that would kill the try tag.
  588:         %% Although probably safe in practice, beam_validator does not
  589:         %% consider it safe.
  590:         _ = (catch try a after [] end),
  591:         receive after infinity -> ok end
  592:     after
  593:         []
  594:     end.
  595: 
  596: recv_in_try_3() ->
  597:     #{make_ref() =>
  598:           not (catch
  599:                    (catch 9 = kid)#{key =>
  600:                                         receive after infinity ->
  601:                                                         ok
  602:                                                 end})}.
  603: 
  604: recv_in_try_4() ->
  605:     #{make_ref() =>
  606:           not (catch
  607:                    (catch 9 = kid)#{key =>
  608:                                         receive
  609:                                         [] when false ->
  610:                                                 ok
  611:                                         end})}.
  612: recv_in_try_5() ->
  613:     try [] of
  614:         [] ->
  615:             <<
  616:               << <<0>> || <<3:4>> <= <<3:4>> >>:(get()),
  617:               receive
  618:               after
  619:                   infinity -> ok
  620:               end
  621:             >>
  622:     after
  623:         ok
  624:     end.
  625: 
  626: recv_in_catch_1() ->
  627:     catch
  628:         (catch
  629:              try
  630:                  some_module
  631:              after
  632:                  ok
  633:              end):some_function(receive
  634:                                 after infinity -> ok
  635:                                 end#{key := value}).
  636: 
  637: %% ERL-703. The compiler would crash because beam_utils:anno_defs/1
  638: %% failed to take into account that code after loop_rec_end is
  639: %% unreachable.
  640: 
  641: double_recv(_Config) ->
  642:     self() ! {more,{a,term}},
  643:     ok = do_double_recv({more,{a,term}}, any),
  644:     self() ! message,
  645:     ok = do_double_recv(whatever, message),
  646: 
  647:     error = do_double_recv({more,42}, whatever),
  648:     error = do_double_recv(whatever, whatever),
  649:     ok.
  650: 
  651: do_double_recv({more, Rest}, _Msg) ->
  652:     receive
  653:         {more, Rest} ->
  654:             ok
  655:     after 0 ->
  656:             error
  657:     end;
  658: do_double_recv(_, Msg) ->
  659:     receive
  660:         Msg ->
  661:             ok
  662:     after 0 ->
  663:             error
  664:     end.
  665: 
  666: %% Test 'after Z', when Z =:= 0 been propagated as an immediate by the type
  667: %% optimization pass.
  668: receive_var_zero(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  669:     self() ! x,
  670:     self() ! y,
  671:     Z = zero(),
  672:     timeout = receive
  673:                   z -> ok
  674:               after Z -> timeout
  675:               end,
  676:     timeout = receive
  677:               after Z -> timeout
  678:               end,
  679:     self() ! w,
  680:     receive
  681: 	x ->
  682:             receive y -> ok end,
  683:             receive w -> ok end;
  684: 	Other ->
  685: 	    ct:fail({bad_message,Other})
  686:     end.
  687: 
  688: zero() -> 0.
  689: 
  690: %% ERL-862; the validator would explode when a term was constructed in a
  691: %% receive guard.
  692: 
  693: -define(MATCH_BUILT_TERM(Ref, Expr),
  694:         (fun() ->
  695:                  Ref = make_ref(),
  696:                  A = id($a),
  697:                  B = id($b),
  698:                  Built = id(Expr),
  699:                  self() ! {Ref, A, B},
  700:                  receive
  701:                      {Ref, A, B} when Expr =:= Built ->
  702:                          ok
  703:                  after 5000 ->
  704:                      ct:fail("Failed to match message with term built in "
  705:                              "receive guard.")
  706:                  end
  707:          end)()).
  708: 
  709: match_built_terms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  710:     ?MATCH_BUILT_TERM(Ref, [A, B]),
  711:     ?MATCH_BUILT_TERM(Ref, {A, B}),
  712:     ?MATCH_BUILT_TERM(Ref, <<A, B>>),
  713:     ?MATCH_BUILT_TERM(Ref, #{ 1 => A, 2 => B}).
  714: 
  715: elusive_common_exit(_Config) ->
  716:     self() ! {1, a},
  717:     self() ! {2, b},
  718:     {[z], [{2,b},{1,a}]} = elusive_loop([x,y,z], 2, []),
  719: 
  720:     CodeServer = whereis(code_server),
  721:     Self = self(),
  722:     Self ! {Self, abc},
  723:     Self ! {CodeServer, []},
  724:     Self ! {Self, other},
  725:     try elusive2([]) of
  726:         Unexpected ->
  727:             ct:fail("Expected an exception; got ~p\n", [Unexpected])
  728:     catch
  729:         throw:[other, CodeServer, Self] ->
  730:             ok
  731:     end,
  732: 
  733:     ok.
  734: 
  735: elusive_loop(List, 0, Results) ->
  736:     {List, Results};
  737: elusive_loop(List, ToReceive, Results) ->
  738:     {Result, RemList} =
  739:         receive
  740:             {_Pos, _R} = Res when List =/= [] ->
  741:                 [_H|T] = List,
  742:                 {Res, T};
  743:             {_Pos, _R} = Res when List =:= [] ->
  744:                 {Res, []}
  745:         end,
  746:     %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen:fix_receives() would fail to find
  747:     %% the common exit block for this receive. That would mean
  748:     %% that it would not insert all necessary copy instructions.
  749:     elusive_loop(RemList, ToReceive-1, [Result | Results]).
  750: 
  751: 
  752: elusive2(Acc) ->
  753:     receive
  754:         {Pid, abc} ->
  755:             ok;
  756:         {Pid, []} ->
  757:             ok;
  758:         {Pid, Res} ->
  759:             %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen:find_loop_exit/2 attempts to find
  760:             %% the first block of the common code after the receive
  761:             %% statement. It used to only look at the two last clauses
  762:             %% of the receive. In this function, the last two clauses
  763:             %% don't have any common block, so it would be assumed
  764:             %% that there was no common block for any of the
  765:             %% clauses. That would mean that copy instructions would
  766:             %% not be inserted as needed.
  767:             throw([Res | Acc])
  768:     end,
  769:     %% Common code.
  770:     elusive2([Pid | Acc]).
  771: 
  772: return_before_receive(_Config) ->
  773:     ref_received = do_return_before_receive(),
  774:     ok.
  775: 
  776: do_return_before_receive() ->
  777:     Ref = make_ref(),
  778:     self() ! {ref,Ref},
  779:     maybe_receive(id(false)),
  780:     receive
  781:         {ref,Ref} ->
  782:             ref_received
  783:     after 1 ->
  784:             %% Can only be reached if maybe_receive/1 returned
  785:             %% with the receive marker set.
  786:             timeout
  787:     end.
  788: 
  789: maybe_receive(Bool) ->
  790:     NewRef = make_ref(),
  791:     case Bool of
  792:         true ->
  793:             receive
  794:                 NewRef ->
  795:                     ok
  796:             end;
  797:         false ->
  798:             %% The receive marker must not be set when
  799:             %% leaving this function.
  800:             ok
  801:     end.
  802: 
  803: trapping(_Config) ->
  804:     ok = do_trapping(0),
  805:     ok = do_trapping(1),
  806:     ok.
  807: 
  808: %% Simplified from emulator's binary_SUITE:trapping/1.
  809: do_trapping(N) ->
  810:     Ref = make_ref(),
  811:     self() ! Ref,
  812:     case N rem 2 of
  813: 	0 ->
  814:             %% Would generate recv_set _, label _, wait_timeout _ _,
  815:             %% which the loader can't handle.
  816:             receive after 1 -> ok end;
  817: 	1 ->
  818:             void
  819:     end,
  820:     receive Ref -> ok end,
  821:     receive after 1 -> ok end.
  822: 
  823: after_expression(_Config) ->
  824:     self() ! {a,message},
  825:     {a,message} = after_expr(0),
  826:     timeout = after_expr(0),
  827:     timeout = after_expr(10),
  828:     ok = after_expr_timeout(0),
  829:     ok = after_expr_timeout(1),
  830:     ok.
  831: 
  832: after_expr(Timeout) ->
  833:     receive
  834:         Msg -> Msg
  835:     after id(Timeout) ->
  836:             timeout
  837:     end.
  838: 
  839: after_expr_timeout(Timeout) ->
  840:     receive
  841:     after id(Timeout) ->
  842:             ok
  843:     end.
  844: 
  845: in_after(_Config) ->
  846:     self() ! first,
  847:     self() ! message,
  848:     do_in_after(fun() -> ok end),
  849:     do_in_after(fun() -> ok end),
  850:     self() ! message,
  851:     catch do_in_after(fun() -> error(bad) end),
  852:     catch do_in_after(fun() -> error(bad) end),
  853:     self() ! last,
  854:     first = receive M1 -> M1 end,
  855:     last = receive M2 -> M2 end,
  856:     ok.
  857: 
  858: do_in_after(E) ->
  859:     try
  860:         E()
  861:     after
  862:         receive
  863:             message ->
  864:                 ok
  865:         after 1 ->
  866:                 ok
  867:         end
  868:     end,
  869:     ok.
  870: 
  871: type_optimized_markers(_Config) ->
  872:     Ref = make_ref(),
  873: 
  874:     self() ! foobar,
  875:     gurka = tom_1(id(undefined)),
  876: 
  877:     self() ! Ref,
  878:     gaffel = tom_1(Ref),
  879: 
  880:     self() ! foobar,
  881:     self() ! undefined,
  882:     gurka = tom_2(id(undefined)),
  883: 
  884:     self() ! Ref,
  885:     gaffel = tom_2(Ref),
  886: 
  887:     self() ! {inet_reply, self(), all_well},
  888:     all_well = tom_3(self(), undefined, 1),
  889: 
  890:     ok.
  891: 
  892: tom_1(Ref) ->
  893:     receive
  894:         foobar ->
  895:             case Ref of
  896:                 undefined ->
  897:                     %% Type optimization might replace the reference with
  898:                     %% 'undefined' here, passing an illegal literal argument
  899:                     %% to 'recv_marker_clear'.
  900:                     gurka;
  901:                 _ ->
  902:                     demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  903:                     gaffel
  904:             end;
  905:         Ref ->
  906:             gaffel
  907:     end.
  908: 
  909: tom_2(Ref) ->
  910:     receive
  911:         foobar ->
  912:             case Ref of
  913:                 undefined ->
  914:                     %% As tom_1/1 but with 'recv_marker_use'
  915:                     %% instead.
  916:                     receive
  917:                         Ref ->
  918:                             gurka
  919:                     end;
  920:                 _ ->
  921:                     demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
  922:                     gaffel
  923:             end;
  924:         Ref ->
  925:             gaffel
  926:     end.
  927: 
  928: tom_3(S, Mref, ReplyTimeout) ->
  929:     receive
  930:         {inet_reply, S, Status} ->
  931:             case Mref of
  932:                 undefined ->
  933:                     ok;
  934:                 _ ->
  935:                     demonitor(Mref, [flush])
  936:             end,
  937:             Status
  938:     after
  939:         ReplyTimeout ->
  940:             tom_3(S, monitor(process, S), ReplyTimeout)
  941:     end.
  942: 
  943: bs_get_tail(_Config) ->
  944:     Ref = make_ref(),
  945:     self() ! {<<1,"abc">>, Ref},
  946:     {<<"abc">>,Ref} = do_bs_get_tail(),
  947: 
  948:     ok.
  949: 
  950: do_bs_get_tail() ->
  951:     receive
  952:         {<<1, FieldsBin/bits>>, StreamRef} ->
  953:             A = id(FieldsBin),
  954:             B = id(StreamRef),
  955:             {A,B}
  956:     end.
  957: 
  958: %%%
  959: %%% Common utilities.
  960: %%%
  961: 
  962: smoke_receive(Fun) ->
  963:     NoClausesLeft = spawn(Fun),
  964:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  965:     exit(NoClausesLeft, kill).
  966: 
  967: id(I) -> I.
